text.p: These are the leading stories in the Botswana press on Friday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- A Motswana woman has been exposed in a document presented by the African National Congress to the South Africa's truth commission as a spy for the former apartheid government.

- The suspended manager of the Motor Vehicle Insurance Fund and a former permanent secretary in the ministry of finance, John Stoneham, has pleaded guilty to allegedly misappropriating 220,000 pula from the fund. He is expected to be sentenced next week.
